meanings.definition: The state or quality of being impermanent.
meanings.sent1: The impermanence of the sandcastle was evident as the waves washed it away.
meanings.sent2: The impermanence of childhood is a natural part of growing up.
meanings.sent3: The impermanence of the ice cream cone made it a race against time to finish it before it melted.
meanings.sent4: The impermanence of the seasons reminds us of the fleeting nature of time.
meanings.sent5: The impermanence of the butterfly's beauty left us in awe of its brief existence.

meanings.definition: The fact or condition of being temporary or transient.
meanings.sent1: We must accept the impermanence of life and cherish each moment.
meanings.sent2: The impermanence of the snowfall meant that it would soon melt in the sun.
meanings.sent3: The impermanence of the pop-up shop added to its allure for shoppers looking for unique finds.
meanings.sent4: The impermanence of fame can be a humbling experience for many celebrities.
meanings.sent5: The impermanence of the rainbow painted a fleeting masterpiece in the sky.
